snippet: Allison M. Macfarlane, a geologist, questions the nuclear power industry’s evaluation of earthquake vulnerability.
abstract: Allison Macfarlane, the new chairwoman of the Nuclear Regulatory Commission, heads vote to suspend licensing for nuclear plants, citing concerns that the industry's evaluation of earthquake vulnerability is inadequate; also announces that she is optimistic that consensus can be reached on a site for burying nuclear waste.
lead_paragraph: Allison M. Macfarlane, a geologist, questions the nuclear power industry’s evaluation of earthquake vulnerability.

headline.seo: New Nuclear Commission Chief Faces Safety Questions
headline.main: For New Nuclear Chief, Concerns Over Plant Safety
